definition: in order to warn against following bad examples (idiom)/as a warning to others
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
outstanding/particularly, especially/a fault/to express discontentment against

sentences.english: The boss made an example of the worker.
sentences.chinese: 老闆懲罰那個工人，以儆效尤。

definition: lit. kill one to warn a hundred (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to behead sb and display the head in public
lit. punish one, warn one hundred (idiom)/fig. to make an example of sb
lit. to punish a little to prevent a lot (idiom); to criticize former mistakes firmly to prevent large scale repetition
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
